intro: Hieracium bracteolatum subsp. kastanitzense, commonly known as the Kastanitz's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy structure. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and meadows. It features basal rosettes of leaves and produces yellow flowers in the summer months. Its botanical features include hairy stems and linear, often pubescent leaves.
